Package modele.plateau

Class Plateau

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
modele.plateau.Plateau
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlateauCarre, PlateauRectangulaire
public abstract class Plateau
extends java.util.Observable
This abstract class will be used to implement the boards of the game The game will offer two boards : a rectangular and a square board. The boundarises of the boards are designed to be imaginary

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer[],​Carte> cases
    cases represent the different spaces reserved for the cards.
    protected boolean centreOccupe
    centreOccupe tells if the center of the board has been used, especially for the first play.
    protected int d1Neg
    d1Pos is and indicator of the left corner of the board.
    protected int d1Pos
    d1Pos is and indicator of the right corner of the board.
    protected int d2Neg
    d1Pos is and indicator of the bottom corner of the board.
    protected int d2Pos
    d2Pos is and indicator of the top corner of the board.

  • Method Details

    • accepterCarte

      public abstract boolean accepterCarte​(Carte carte, int[] position)
      Is used by the board to receive a card.
      Parameters:
      carte - is the card the player wants to play.
      position - is the place the player wants to put the card.
      Returns:
      true if the placement of the card is correct.

    • accepterDeplacementCarte

      public abstract boolean accepterDeplacementCarte​(int[] positionInitiale, int[] positionFinale)
      Is used by the board to move a card
      Parameters:
      positionInitiale - is the position the card actually is.
      positionFinale - is the place the player wants to put the card.
      Returns:
      true if the card movement is correct

    • accepterVisite

      public void accepterVisite​(VisiteurPlateau visiteur)
      Authorizes a visitor to go through the board.
      Parameters:
      visiteur - is the visitor of the board

    • recupererMaxSansCarte

      public int[] recupererMaxSansCarte​(int[] position, int dim)
      Is used to find a maximum index on the board if we have to remove a card.
      Parameters:
      position - is the position of card that may be removed.
      dim - is the direction for whom we are looking a maximum.
      Returns:
      the maximum index found.

    • recupererMinSansCarte

      public int[] recupererMinSansCarte​(int[] position, int dim)
      Is used to find a minimum index on the board if we have to remove a card.
      Parameters:
      position - is the position of card that may be removed.
      dim - is the direction for whom we are looking a minimum.
      Returns:
      the minimum index found.

    • referencePosi

      public java.lang.Integer[] referencePosi​(java.lang.Integer[] pos)
      Gets the reference of the element in our board that is at a specified position
      Parameters:
      pos - is the position of the element we want the reference on.
      Returns:
      the reference of the element or null.

    • verifierAdjacence

      public boolean verifierAdjacence​(int[] position)
      Ensures that the card we want to play is next to another card.
      Parameters:
      position - is the position of the card we want to play.
      Returns:
      true if the card is next to another card, false if it is not the case

    • verifierConformitePlacement

      public abstract boolean verifierConformitePlacement​(int[] position)
      Abstract method that will be used to ensure that a play is valid.
      Parameters:
      position - where the player wants to play.
      Returns:
      true if the play is valid.

    • verifierLimites

      public boolean verifierLimites​(int[] position)
      Makes sure that the card placement is not out of the board's boundaries.
      Parameters:
      position - is the position where the player wants to put the card
      Returns:
      true if the position is in the boundaries.

    • verifierLimitesDeplacement

      public boolean verifierLimitesDeplacement​(int[] positionInitiale, int[] positionFinale)
      Abstract method that will be used to ensure that a card movement is valid.
      Parameters:
      positionInitiale - the initial position of the card.
      positionFinale - the position where the player wants to put the card
      Returns:
      true if the card movement is valid.

    • verifierNonSuperposition

      public boolean verifierNonSuperposition​(int[] position)
      Ensures that a player does not put a card on another one.
      Parameters:
      position - the position where the player wants to play.
      Returns:
      true if the player doesn't put a card on another one.
